intro: Carvi careum, commonly known as the African mountain pepper, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Ethiopia and Eritrea. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, peppery leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Carvi careum thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, temperate climate to flourish. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of aromatic plants and their ecological roles.
